text: Hey guys, is it possible to delete a row or column from a multi-dimensional array (say a matrix) “in-place”? Somewhat similar to what `deleteat!` does for vectors. I guess the answer is no but I thought I’d ask (and test our new bridging system :bridge_at_night: ). Thanks in advance. (second attempt :D)

elements.text: Hey guys, is it possible to delete a row or column from a multi-dimensional array (say a matrix) “in-place”? Somewhat similar to what

text: Hey <@U881D0W2C>! Thanks for asking this question. It has been cross posted to discourse here: <https://discourse.julialang.org/t/hey-guys-is-it-possible-to-delete-a-row-or-column-from-a-multi-dimensional-array-say-a-matrix-in-place-somewhat-similar-to-what-deleteat-does-for-vectors-i-guess-the-answer-is-no-but-i-thought-i-d-ask-and-test-our-new-bridging>. Please add an answer there once you are satisfied with the solution so others can benfit as well.

text: They could theoretically, but for now it’s just the main question and then then the answer has to be ported manually

elements.text: They could theoretically, but for now it’s just the main question and then then the answer has to be ported manually

text:
To answer the original question you could do something like this:
```julia> a = [1 2; 3 4]
2×2 Array{Int64,2}:
 1  2
 3  4

julia> reshape(resize!(vec(a), length(a) - size(a, 1)), size(a, 1), :)
2×1 Array{Int64,2}:
 1
 3```

elements.text: To answer the original question you could do something like this:

julia> a = [1 2; 3 4]
2×2 Array{Int64,2}:
 1  2
 3  4

julia> reshape(resize!(vec(a), length(a) - size(a, 1)), size(a, 1), :)
2×1 Array{Int64,2}:
 1
 3

text: Personally, I'd rather not have my answers in helpdesk automatically bridged into discourse - it's a different style of communication, and I (at least try to) have my answers on discourse be more thought out and and long form - maybe there's some way to mark a particular answer here as the "solution" which then gets transferred?

text: <@U881D0W2C> Yes, you can just replace `size(a, 1)` with `size(a)[2:end]...` to always resize the last dimension of a higher-dimensional array

elements.text: Yes, you can just replace
size(a, 1)
with
size(a)[2:end]...
to always resize the last dimension of a higher-dimensional array

text: That’s something. But it only works for the last dimension. What about the generic case, i.e dropping, say, the second column of a 1x2x3x4 sized array?

elements.text: That’s something. But it only works for the last dimension. What about the generic case, i.e dropping, say, the second column of a 1x2x3x4 sized array?

text: You should be able to use a similar approach there as well. You just need to convert whatever you want to delete to linear indices and then you can use `deleteat!` after reshaping to a vector with `vec`

after reshaping to a vector with
vec
